SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.levels

Class LevelOne

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
com.example.demo.levels.LevelParent
com.example.demo.levels.LevelOne
public class LevelOne extends LevelParent
Represents the first level of the game. This class extends `LevelParent` and sets up the specific parameters and behaviors for level one.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • isGameOver

      protected void isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over. If the user is destroyed, the game is lost. If the user has reached the kill target, advances to the next level.
      Specified by:
      isGameOver in class LevelParent

    • isUserAtKillTarget

      private boolean isUserAtKillTarget()
      Checks if the user has reached the kill target.
      Returns:
      true if the user has reached the kill target, false otherwise

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes friendly units by adding the user to the root.
      Specified by:
      initializeFriendlyUnits in class LevelParent

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected void spawnEnemyUnits(int maxEnemiesOnScreen, double enemySpawnProbability, double enemyFireRate)
      Spawns enemy units with the specified parameters.
      Overrides:
      spawnEnemyUnits in class LevelParent
      Parameters:
      maxEnemiesOnScreen - the maximum number of enemies on screen
      enemySpawnProbability - the probability of spawning an enemy
      enemyFireRate - the fire rate of the enemy

    • spawnPowerups

      protected void spawnPowerups(int maxPowerupsOnScreen, double powerupSpawnProbability)
      Spawns powerups with the specified parameters. No powerups are spawned in level one.
      Overrides:
      spawnPowerups in class LevelParent
      Parameters:
      maxPowerupsOnScreen - the maximum number of powerups on screen
      powerupSpawnProbability - the probability of spawning a powerup
